alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 4:22PM EDT until July 12 at 11:36AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Connecticut River Below Holyoke affecting Hampden County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts... Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Hartford and Middlesex Counties. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hartford and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River ABOVE Holyoke Dam affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Montague affecting Franklin and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. For the Connecticut River...including Holyoke, Middle Haddam, Montague, Holyoke Dam, Northampton, Hartford, Thompsonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Farmington River at Simsbury. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 5.1 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 630 AM EDT.
